definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which build desolate places for themselves;
sentences.chinese: 和地上为自己重造荒邱的君王，谋士。

sentences.english: Jobs has used his natural gift and talents to remake Apple.
sentences.chinese: 乔布斯用他与生俱来的天赋与天才重造苹果。

sentences.english: We need a massive reforestation programme.
sentences.chinese: 我们还有一个大规模的重造热带雨林计划。

sentences.english: To reset the all external nose and repair with Chinese flap or frontal flap for reconstruction of the external nose.
sentences.chinese: 全鼻切除者，取游离前臂桡侧皮瓣或额瓣重造全鼻。

sentences.english: And remake the world they did.
sentences.chinese: 重造天地，他们的确做到了。

definition: to give a new lease of life/to reconstruct/to reform/to rework/to recycle/to reproduce (copies, or offspring)/restoration/restructuring
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
crash/breakdown (of social values etc)/burst/to crumble/to collapse
variant of 洗練|洗练[xi3 lian4]
(of insects) to undergo metamorphosis/(fig.) to be transformed/to metamorphose/to become degraded
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
